00035 my $i = -1;
00036 our @DB_VERSIONS;
00037 
00038 $DB_VERSIONS[++$i]{desc} = "is the initial version of database, identical to database structure in WeBWorK 2.2.x.";
00039 
00040 $DB_VERSIONS[++$i]{desc} = "adds dbupgrade table to facilitate automatic database upgrades.";
00041 $DB_VERSIONS[  $i]{global_code} = sub {
00042     $self->dbh->do("CREATE TABLE `dbupgrade` (`name` VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY, `value` TEXT)");
00043     $self->dbh->do("INSERT INTO `dbupgrade` (`name`, `value`) VALUES (?, ?)", {}, "db_version", 1);
00044     $self->register_sql_table("dbupgrade");
00045 };
00046 
00047 $DB_VERSIONS[++$i]{desc} = "adds problems_per_page field to set and set_user tables of each course.";
00048 $DB_VERSIONS[  $i]{course_code} = sub {
00049     my $course = shift;
00050     $self->dbh->do("ALTER TABLE `${course}_set` ADD COLUMN `problems_per_page` INT")
00051         if $self->sql_table_exists("${course}_set");
00052     $self->dbh->do("ALTER TABLE `${course}_set_user` ADD COLUMN `problems_per_page` INT")
00053         if $self->sql_table_exists("${course}_set_user");
00054 };
00055 
00056 $DB_VERSIONS[++$i]{desc} = "adds depths table to keep track of dvipng depth information.";
00057 $DB_VERSIONS[  $i]{global_code} = sub {
00058     $self->dbh->do("CREATE TABLE depths (md5 CHAR(33) NOT NULL, depth SMALLINT, PRIMARY KEY (md5))");
00059     $self->register_sql_table("depths");
00060 };
00061 
00062 $DB_VERSIONS[++$i]{desc} = "changes type of key timestamp field to BIGINT";
00063 $DB_VERSIONS[  $i]{course_code} = sub {
00064     my $course = shift;
00065     return unless $self->sql_table_exists("${course}_key");
00066     $self->dbh->do("ALTER TABLE `${course}_key` CHANGE COLUMN `timestamp` `timestamp` BIGINT");
00067 };
00068 
00069 $DB_VERSIONS[++$i]{desc} = "changes type of problem_user status field to FLOAT";
00070 $DB_VERSIONS[  $i]{course_code} = sub {
00071     my $course = shift;
00072     return unless $self->sql_table_exists("${course}_problem_user");
00073     $self->dbh->do("UPDATE `${course}_problem_user` SET `status`=NULL WHERE `status`=''");
00074     $self->dbh->do("ALTER TABLE `${course}_problem_user` CHANGE COLUMN `status` `status` FLOAT");
00075 };

00077 $DB_VERSIONS[++$i]{desc} = "changes types of alphanumeric keyfields to TINYBLOB NOT NULL";
00078 $DB_VERSIONS[  $i]{course_code} = sub {
00079     my $course = shift;
00080     $self->dbh->do("ALTER TABLE `${course}_user` CHANGE COLUMN `user_id` `user_id` TINYBLOB NOT NULL")
00081         if $self->sql_table_exists("${course}_user");
00082     $self->dbh->do("ALTER TABLE `${course}_password` CHANGE COLUMN `user_id` `user_id` TINYBLOB NOT NULL")
00083         if $self->sql_table_exists("${course}_password");
00084     $self->dbh->do("ALTER TABLE `${course}_permission` CHANGE COLUMN `user_id` `user_id` TINYBLOB NOT NULL")
00085         if $self->sql_table_exists("${course}_permission");
00086     $self->dbh->do("ALTER TABLE `${course}_key` CHANGE COLUMN `user_id` `user_id` TINYBLOB NOT NULL")
00087         if $self->sql_table_exists("${course}_key");
00088     $self->dbh->do("ALTER TABLE `${course}_set` CHANGE COLUMN `set_id` `set_id` TINYBLOB NOT NULL")
00089         if $self->sql_table_exists("${course}_set");
00090     $self->dbh->do("ALTER TABLE `${course}_problem` CHANGE COLUMN `set_id` `set_id` TINYBLOB NOT NULL")
00091         if $self->sql_table_exists("${course}_problem");
00092     $self->dbh->do("ALTER TABLE `${course}_set_user` CHANGE COLUMN `user_id` `user_id` TINYBLOB NOT NULL")
00093         if $self->sql_table_exists("${course}_set_user");
00094     $self->dbh->do("ALTER TABLE `${course}_set_user` CHANGE COLUMN `set_id` `set_id` TINYBLOB NOT NULL")
00095         if $self->sql_table_exists("${course}_set_user");
00096     $self->dbh->do("ALTER TABLE `${course}_problem_user` CHANGE COLUMN `user_id` `user_id` TINYBLOB NOT NULL")
00097         if $self->sql_table_exists("${course}_problem_user");
00098     $self->dbh->do("ALTER TABLE `${course}_problem_user` CHANGE COLUMN `set_id` `set_id` TINYBLOB NOT NULL")
00099         if $self->sql_table_exists("${course}_problem_user");
00100 };

00188     }

00190         $self->dbh->do("ALTER TABLE `${course}_set_user` ADD COLUMN `hide_score` ENUM('0','1')");
00191         $self->dbh->do("ALTER TABLE `${course}_set_user` ADD COLUMN `hide_work` ENUM('0','1')");

00233 $DB_VERSIONS[  $i]{global_code} = sub {
00234     $self->dbh->do("CREATE TABLE locations (location_id TINYBLOB NOT NULL, description TEXT, PRIMARY KEY (location_id(1000)))");
00235     $self->dbh->do("CREATE TABLE location_addresses (location_id TINYBLOB NOT NULL, ip_mask TINYBLOB NOT NULL, PRIMARY KEY (location_id(500),ip_mask(500)))");
00236 };

00241     $self->dbh->do("CREATE TABLE `${course}_set_locations_user` (set_id TINYBLOB NOT NULL, user_id TINYBLOB NOT NULL, location_id TINYBLOB NOT NULL, PRIMARY KEY (set_id(300),user_id(300),location_id(300)))");
00242

00244         $self->dbh->do("ALTER TABLE `${course}_set` ADD COLUMN `restrict_ip` enum('No','RestrictTo','DenyFrom') DEFAULT 'No'");
00245     }
00246     if ( $self->sql_table_exists("${course}_set_user") ) {
00247         $self->dbh->do("ALTER TABLE `${course}_set_user` ADD COLUMN `restrict_ip` enum('No','RestrictTo','DenyFrom')");
00248     }
00249 };

00275 $DB_VERSIONS[++$i]{desc} = "adds set and set_user fields to allow set-level proctor, updates permissions to allow finer-grained regulation of proctoring.";
00276 $DB_VERSIONS[  $i]{course_code} = sub {
00277     my $course = shift;
00278     if ( $self->sql_table_exists("${course}_permission") ) {
00279         $self->dbh->do("UPDATE `${course}_permission` SET `permission`=3 where `permission`=2");
00280     }
00281     if ( $self->sql_table_exists("${course}_set") ) {
00282         $self->dbh->do("ALTER TABLE `${course}_set` ADD COLUMN `restricted_login_proctor` ENUM('No','Yes') DEFAULT 'No'");
00283     }
00284     if ( $self->sql_table_exists("${course}_set_user") ) {
00285         $self->dbh->do("ALTER TABLE `${course}_set_user` ADD COLUMN `restricted_login_proctor` ENUM('No','Yes')");
00286     }
00287 };

00289 $DB_VERSIONS[++$i]{desc} = "adds per-course setting table";
00290 $DB_VERSIONS[  $i]{course_code} = sub {
00291     my $course = shift;
00292     $self->dbh->do("CREATE TABLE `${course}_setting` (`name` VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY, `value` TEXT)");
00293     $self->register_sql_table("${course}_setting");
00294     $self->dbh->do("INSERT INTO `${course}_setting` (`name`, `value`) VALUES (?, ?)", {}, "db_version", $i);
00295 };

00301 
00302 sub new {
00303     my $invocant = shift;
00304     my $class = ref $invocant || $invocant;
00305     my $self = bless {}, $class;
00306     $self->init(@_);
00307     return $self;
00308 }
00309 
00310 sub init {
00311     my ($self, %options) = @_;
00312     
00313     $self->{dbh} = DBI->connect(
00314         $options{ce}{database_dsn},
00315         $options{ce}{database_username},
00316         $options{ce}{database_password},
00317         {
00318             PrintError => 0,
00319             RaiseError => 1,
00320         },
00321     );
00322     $self->{verbose_sub} = $options{verbose_sub} || \&debug;
00323     $self->{confirm_sub} = $options{confirm_sub} || \&ask_permission_stdio;
00324     $self->{ce} = $options{ce};
00325     $self->{course_db_versions} = {};
00326 }
00327 
00328 sub ce { return shift->{ce} }
00329 sub dbh { return shift->{dbh} }
00330 sub verbose { my $sub = shift->{verbose_sub}; return &$sub(@_) }
00331 sub confirm { my $sub = shift->{confirm_sub}; return &$sub(@_) }
00332 
00333 sub DESTROY {
00334     my ($self) = @_;
00335     $self->unlock_database;
00336     $self->SUPER::DESTROY if $self->can("SUPER::DESTROY");
00337 }
00338 
00339 ################################################################################
00340 
00341 sub lock_database {
00342     my ($self) = @_;
00343     
00344     $self->verbose("Obtaining dbupgrade lock...\n");
00345     my ($lock_status) = $self->dbh->selectrow_array("SELECT GET_LOCK('dbupgrade', 10)");
00346     if (not defined $lock_status) {
00347         die "Couldn't obtain lock because an error occurred.\n";
00348     }
00349     if ($lock_status) {
00350         $self->verbose("Got lock.\n");
00351     } else {
00352         die "Timed out while waiting for lock.\n";
00353     }
00354 }
00355 
00356 sub unlock_database {
00357     my ($self) = @_;
00358     
00359     $self->verbose("Releasing dbupgrade lock...\n");
00360     my ($lock_status) = $self->dbh->selectrow_array("SELECT RELEASE_LOCK('dbupgrade')");
00361     if (not defined $lock_status) {
00362         die "Couldn't release lock because the lock does not exist.\n";
00363     }
00364     if ($lock_status) {
00365         $self->verbose("Released lock.\n");
00366     } else {
00367         die "Couldn't release lock because the lock is not held by this thread.\n";
00368     }
00369 }
00370 
00371 ################################################################################
00372 
00373 sub load_sql_table_list {
00374     my ($self) = @_;
00375     my $sql_tables_ref = $self->dbh->selectcol_arrayref("SHOW TABLES");
00376     $self->{sql_tables} = {}; @{$self->{sql_tables}}{@$sql_tables_ref} = ();
00377 }
00378 
00379 sub register_sql_table {
00380     my ($self, $table) = @_;
00381     $self->{sql_tables}{$table} = ();
00382 }
00383 
00384 sub unregister_sql_table {
00385     my ($self, $table) = @_;
00386     delete $self->{sql_tables}{$table};
00387 }
00388 
00389 sub sql_table_exists {
00390     my ($self, $table) = @_;
00391     return exists $self->{sql_tables}{$table};
00392 }
00393 
00394 ################################################################################
00395 
00396 use constant DB_TABLE_MISSING  => -1;
00397 use constant DB_RECORD_MISSING => -2;
00398 
00399 sub get_db_version {
00400     my ($self, $course) = @_;
00401     my $table = defined $course ? "${course}_setting" : "dbupgrade";
00402     if ($self->sql_table_exists($table)) {
00403         my $table_quoted = $self->dbh->quote_identifier($table);
00404         my @record = $self->dbh->selectrow_array("SELECT `value` FROM $table_quoted WHERE `name`='db_version'");
00405         if (@record) {
00406             return $record[0];
00407         } else {
00408             return DB_RECORD_MISSING;
00409         }
00410     } else {
00411         return DB_TABLE_MISSING;
00412     }
00413 }
00414 
00415 my $vers_value_should_be = "The value should always be a positive integer.";
00416 sub check_db_version_format {
00417     my ($self, $db_version) = @_;
00418     if (not defined $db_version) {
00419         return "'db_version' has a NULL value. $vers_value_should_be";
00420     } elsif ($db_version !~ /^-?\d+$/) {
00421         return "'db_version' is set to the non-numeric value '$db_version'. $vers_value_should_be";
00422     } elsif ($db_version < 0) {
00423         return "'db_version' is set to the negative value '$db_version'. $vers_value_should_be";
00424     } elsif ($db_version == 0) {
00425         return "'db_version' is set to 0, which is reserved to indicate a pre-automatic-upgrade version. $vers_value_should_be";
00426     } else {
00427         # db_version is a positive integer! yay!
00428         return;
00429     }
00430 }
00431 
00432 sub set_db_version {
00433     my ($self, $vers, $course) = @_;
00434     my $table = defined $course ? "${course}_setting" : "dbupgrade";
00435     my $table_quoted = $self->dbh->quote_identifier($table);
00436     $self->dbh->do("UPDATE $table_quoted SET `value`=? WHERE `name`='db_version'", {}, $vers);
00437 }
00438 
00439 ################################################################################
00440 
00441 sub do_upgrade {
00442     my ($self) = @_;
00443     
00444     $self->lock_database;
00445     $self->load_sql_table_list;
00446     
00447     #### Get system's database version
00448     
00449     my $system_db_version = $self->get_db_version();
00450     
00451     if ($system_db_version == DB_TABLE_MISSING) {
00452         warn "No 'upgrade' table exists: assuming system database version is 0.\n";
00453         $system_db_version = 0;
00454     } elsif ($system_db_version == DB_RECORD_MISSING) {
00455         die "The 'dbupgrade' table exists in the database, but no 'db_version' record exists in it. Can't continue.\n";
00456     } elsif (my $error = $self->check_db_version_format($system_db_version)) {
00457         die "$error Can't continue.\n";
00458     } elsif ($system_db_version > $THIS_DB_VERSION) {
00459         die "This database's system db_version value is $system_db_version, but the current database version is only $THIS_DB_VERSION. This database was probably used with a newer version of WeBWorK. Can't continue.\n";
00460     }
00461     
00462     $self->verbose("Initial system db_version is $system_db_version\n");
00463     
00464     #### Get database version for each course
00465     # If $system_db_version < $FIRST_COURSE_DB_VERSION, most courses will not have
00466     # a db_version, but some might. (Say, if they were imported from a newer
00467     # version of WeBWorK.)
00468     
00469     my @ww_courses = listCourses($self->ce);
00470     $self->{ww_courses} = \@ww_courses;
00471 
00472     my $course_db_versions = $self->{course_db_versions};
00473 
00474     foreach my $course (@ww_courses) {
00475         my $course_db_version = $self->get_db_version($course);
00476         
00477         if ($system_db_version < $FIRST_COURSE_DB_VERSION) {
00478             
00479             if ($course_db_version == DB_TABLE_MISSING) {
00480                 # this is to be expected -- we assume the course is at the current system version
00481                 $self->verbose("Course '$course' has no db_version of it's own, assuming system db_version $system_db_version.\n");
00482                 $course_db_versions->{$course} = $system_db_version;
00483             } else {
00484                 # there is a settings table -- the course is probably from a later version of WW
00485                 warn "The course '$course' already contains a '${course}_setting' table."
00486                     ." Settings tables were introduced at db_version $FIRST_COURSE_DB_VERSION,"
00487                     ." but the current system db_version is only $system_db_version."
00488                     ." We'll assume that this course is from a later version of WeBWorK"
00489                     ." and try to determine the course's version...\n";
00490                 if ($course_db_version == DB_RECORD_MISSING) {
00491                     warn "There is no 'db_version' record in the course's settings table,"
00492                         ." so we can't determine the version. This course will be excluded from upgrades."
00493                         ." If you know the version of this course,"
00494                         ." add a 'db_version' record with the appropriate value to the '${course}_setting' table.\n";
00495                 } elsif (my $error = check_db_version_format($course_db_version)) {
00496                     warn "$error\n";
00497                     warn "There is a 'db_version' record in the course's settings table,"
00498                         ." but it has an invalid value , so we can't determine the version."
00499                         ." This course will be excluded from upgrades."
00500                         ." If you know the version of this course,"
00501                         ." update 'db_version' record in the '${course}_setting' table with the appropriate value.\n";
00502                 } elsif ($course_db_version < $FIRST_COURSE_DB_VERSION) {
00503                     warn "This course's version is $course_db_version, which is before per-course versioning was introduced."
00504                         ." Therefore, a course at version $course_db_version should have neither a '${course}_setting' table"
00505                         ." nor a 'db_version' record in that table. Regardless, we will assume the recorded version is correct.\n";
00506                     $course_db_versions->{$course} = $system_db_version;
00507                 } else {
00508                     warn "This course's version is $course_db_version, which makes sense.\n";
00509                     $course_db_versions->{$course} = $course_db_version;
00510                 }
00511             }
00512             
00513         } else {
00514             
00515             if ($course_db_version == DB_TABLE_MISSING) {
00516                 warn "The course '$course' is missing a '${course}_setting' table, so we can't determine the version."
00517                     ." This course will be ignored."
00518                     ." If you know the version of this course, add a '${course}_setting' table"
00519                     ." and add a 'db_version' record with the appropriate value to the table.\n";
00520             } else {
00521                 # there is a settings table -- good
00522                 if ($course_db_version == DB_RECORD_MISSING) {
00523                     warn "The course '$course' is missing a 'db_version' record in its '${course}_setting' table,"
00524                         ." so we can't determine the version. This course will be ignored."
00525                         ." If you know the version of this course,"
00526                         ." add a 'db_version' record with the appropriate value to the '${course}_setting' table.\n";
00527                 } elsif (my $error = check_db_version_format($course_db_version)) {
00528                     warn "$error\n";
00529                     warn "The course '$course' has an invalid value in the 'db_version' record in its '${course}_setting' table,"
00530                         ." so we can't determine the version. This course will be ignored."
00531                         ." If you know the version of this course,"
00532                         ." update the 'db_version' record in the '${course}_setting' table with the appropriate value.\n";
00533                 } elsif ($course_db_version < $FIRST_COURSE_DB_VERSION) {
00534                     warn "This course's version is $course_db_version, which is before per-course versioning was introduced."
00535                         ." Therefore, a course at version $course_db_version should have neither a '${course}_setting' table"
00536                         ." nor a 'db_version' record in that table. Regardless, we will assume the recorded version is correct.\n";
00537                     $course_db_versions->{$course} = $course_db_version;
00538                 } else {
00539                     $self->verbose("Course '$course' has valid db_version $course_db_version.\n");
00540                     $course_db_versions->{$course} = $system_db_version;
00541                 }
00542             }
00543             
00544         }
00545     }
00546 
00547     $self->verbose(map { "$_ => $$course_db_versions{$_}\n" } keys %$course_db_versions);
00548 
00549     #### Determine lowest version
00550 
00551     my $lowest_db_version = $system_db_version;
00552     foreach my $v (values %$course_db_versions) {
00553         $lowest_db_version = $v if $v < $lowest_db_version;
00554     }
00555 
00556     $self->verbose("Lowest db_version is $lowest_db_version\n");
00557 
00558     #### Do the upgrades
00559 
00560     # upgrade_to_version uses this
00561     $self->{system_db_version} = $system_db_version;
00562     
00563     my $vers = $lowest_db_version;
00564     while ($vers < $THIS_DB_VERSION) {
00565         $vers++;
00566         unless ($self->upgrade_to_version($vers)) {
00567             print "\nUpgrading from version ".($vers-1)." to $vers failed.\n\n";
00568             unless ($self->ask_permission("Ignore this error and go on to the next version?", 0)) {
00569                 exit 3;
00570             }
00571         }
00572     }
00573     
00574     #### All done!
00575     
00576     print "\nDatabase is up-to-date at version $vers.\n";
00577 }
00578 
00579 ################################################################################
00580 
00581 use constant OK => 0;
00582 use constant SKIPPED => 1;
00583 use constant ERROR => 2;
00584 
00585 sub upgrade_to_version {
00586     my ($self, $vers) = @_;
00587     my %info = %{$DB_VERSIONS[$vers]};
00588     
00589     print "\nUpgrading database from version " . ($vers-1) . " to $vers...\n";
00590     my $desc = $info{desc} || "has no description.";
00591     print "(Version $vers $desc)\n";
00592     
00593     if ($self->{system_db_version} < $vers and exists $info{global_code}) {
00594         eval {
00595             local $WeBWorK::Utils::DBUpgrade::self = $self;
00596             $info{global_code}->();
00597         };
00598         if ($@) {
00599             print "\nAn error occured while running the system upgrade code for version $vers:\n";
00600             print "$@";
00601             return 0 unless $self->ask_permission("Ignore this error and keep going?", 0);
00602         }
00603     }
00604     $self->set_db_version($vers);
00605     
00606     my $do_upgrade = 1;
00607     foreach my $course (@{$self->{ww_courses}}) {
00608         if ($do_upgrade) {
00609             my $result = $self->upgrade_course_to_version($course, $vers);
00610             if ($result == ERROR) {
00611                 if ($self->ask_permission("Update course's stored db_version to $vers anyway?", 0)) {
00612                     set_db_version($vers, $course);
00613                     print "OK, updated course's stored db_version.\n";
00614                 } else {
00615                     print "OK, not updating course's stored db_version.\n";
00616                 }
00617                 if ($self->ask_permission("Upgrade the remaining courses to version $vers?", 0)) {
00618                     print "OK, going on to the next course...\n";
00619                 } else {
00620                     print "OK, we'll skip upgrading the rest of the courses to version $vers.\n";
00621                     if ($self->ask_permission("Update the stored db_version for the courses we're skipping, as if we had upgraded them?", 1)) {
00622                         $do_upgrade = 0;
00623                     } else {
00624                         return 0;
00625                     }
00626                 }
00627             } elsif ($result == OK) {
00628                 $self->set_db_version($vers, $course);
00629             } elsif ($result == SKIPPED) {
00630                 # do nothing
00631             }
00632         } else {
00633             $self->set_db_version($vers, $course);
00634         }
00635     }
00636     
00637     return 1;
00638 }
00639 
00640 sub upgrade_course_to_version {
00641     my ($self, $course, $vers) = @_;
00642     my $course_db_versions = $self->{course_db_versions};
00643     my %info = %{$DB_VERSIONS[$vers]};
00644     
00645     my $course_vers = $course_db_versions->{$course};
00646     #$self->verbose("course=$course course_vers=$course_vers vers=$vers\n");
00647     if (not defined $course_vers) {
00648         $self->verbose("Course '$course' has a missing or invalid version -- skipping.\n");
00649         return SKIPPED;
00650     } elsif ($course_vers == $vers) {
00651         $self->verbose("Course '$course' is already at version $vers -- skipping.\n");
00652         return SKIPPED;
00653     } elsif ($course_vers > $vers) {
00654         $self->verbose("Course '$course' version $course_vers > target version $vers -- skipping.\n");
00655         return SKIPPED;
00656     } elsif ($course_vers < $vers-1) {
00657         warn "Course '$course' at version $course_vers, which is too old to upgrade to $vers. This should never happen. Not upgrading.\n";
00658         return SKIPPED;
00659     }
00660     
00661     $self->verbose("Upgrading course '$course' to version $vers...\n");
00662     eval {
00663         local $WeBWorK::Utils::DBUpgrade::self = $self;
00664         $info{course_code}->($course);
00665     };
00666     if ($@) {
00667         print "\nAn error occured while running the course upgrade code for version $vers on course $course:\n";
00668         print "$@";
00669         return ERROR;
00670     } else {
00671         return OK;
00672     }
00673 }
00674 
00675 ################################################################################
00676 
00677 sub ask_permission_stdio {
00678     my ($prompt, $default) = @_;
00679     
00680     $default = 1 if not defined $default;
00681     my $options = $default ? "[Y/n]" : "[y/N]";
00682     
00683     while (1) {
00684         print "$prompt $options ";
00685         my $resp = <STDIN>;
00686         chomp $resp;
00687         return $default if $resp eq "";
00688         return 1 if lc $resp eq "y";
00689         return 0 if lc $resp eq "n";
00690         $prompt = 'Please enter "y" or "n".';
00691     }
00692 }
00693 
00694 1;
